title: Database corruption after duplication
body:
**Describe the bug**
After using `rsync -ah` to duplicate my archive DB, I tried running Nethermind with the cloned DB but it crashed with this error :
```
Step InitDatabase             failed after 5534ms RocksDbSharp.RocksDbException: Corruption: Corruption: IO error: No such file or directory: While open a file for random read: /nethermind/nethermind_db/poacore_archive/state/0/1289410.ldb: No such file or directory in file /nethermind/nethermind_db/poacore_archive/state/0/MANIFEST-1287230
```


**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Get an archive node on POA in sync and up to date (running using docker)
2. Stop the node (docker stop)
3. Use `rsync -ah --info=progress2 ./data/nethermind_db ./your_duplicate` to duplicate your database
4. Use docker to run an archive node, but using the duplicate DB 

**Expected behavior**
I was expecting to have a second archive node up & running without the need to resync all the blockchain

**Logs**

When I rsync my DB :

```bash
root@POA-CORE-ARCHIVE-2:/# rsync --info=progress2 -ah ./node-setup /mnt/volume_poa_archive_2/
          1.70T  99%  240.00MB/s    1:52:39 (xfr#25743, to-chk=979/26794)
```
